page.title: 11CANKER DYKE STREAM-MIRFIELD
page.content: On 23rd May 1985, a warm day after a cold spring, class 3J went to the local church stream called 'Canker Dyke' on the O.S. map. Here is a chart of what we found within 15 minutes. {Stonefly Nymph 9 {Mayfly 13 {Caddis Fly 14 {Freshwater Shrimp 57 {Water Louse 7 {Blood Worm 0 Using these results we concluded that the level of{pollution}was{B}(fairly clean water) on a 5 point scale,{A to {E,}where{A}is the cleanest water. In addition to the listed creatures we also found these:- Newts, Pond Snails, Sticklebacks, Tadpoles, Water Boatmen, Pond Skaters, Pirate Spiders and Whirligig Beetles.
